messages.content:
In just a few weeks, local families face a choice. It's a choice between a Labour government that fights for hardworking families, or five more years of the Tories.

Our NHS is in crisis and families are £1,600 a year worse off under the Tories. They have extreme plans for spending cuts to our NHS and our schools.

Labour's plan for Scotland will deliver a better future for families and protect their NHS with minimum wage, ban exploitative zero-hours contracts, freeze soaring energy prices, deliver a Mansion Tax and a Bankers Bonus Tax.

But if the Tories are the largest party, they would form another coalition with the Lib Dems and Cameron would stay in Downing Street.

Only a vote for Labour can stop the Tories becoming the largest party and forming the next government. Only Labour can deliver the change we need.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour plans to protect the NHS from spending cuts.
Labour's plan for Scotland aims to deliver a better future for families.
Labour intends to increase the minimum wage.
Labour will ban exploitative zero-hours contracts.
Labour will freeze soaring energy prices.
Labour will introduce a Mansion Tax and a Bankers Bonus Tax.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only a vote for Labour can stop the Tories becoming the largest party and forming the next government.

issues.economy: Labour's plan will protect hardworking families from spending cuts to our NHS and schools by the Tories who have left families £1,600 a year worse off.
issues.education: The Tories have extreme plans for spending cuts to our schools.
issues.health: Our NHS is in crisis...Labour's plan for Scotland will protect their NHS.

housing.content: Labour will introduce a Mansion Tax and a Bankers Bonus Tax to support the NHS and public services.

endorsements.endorsement: Sarah believes housing should be at the heart of local communities and with Cammy she can continue her work across Edinburgh's housing association and development trust.
Jas knows Cammy will work to get rid of the bedroom tax.
Terry knows Cammy wants to protect the rights of ordinary workers.
Jackie believes Cammy stands up for our older people and the wider community.
